lom:description.lom:string:
MentorNet (www.MentorNet.net), the E-Mentoring Network for Women in Engineering and Science, is a nonprofit organization which has created and implemented the organizational, educational, and technical infrastructures for a large-scale program to link women studying engineering and related sciences and professionals working in industry or government for structured, supported online mentoring relationships, and related networking and other learning opportunities. Using user-friendly interfaces of the Web and e-mail, MentorNet has also created back-end systems to create a dynamic database, internal and external relationship managment system, and a customized bi-directional matching algorithm to create optimal mentoring matchine between students and professionalsin the database.
Published in: 2002 ECI Conference on e-Technologies in Engineering Education: Learning Outcomes Providing Future Possibilities Davos, Switzerland Editors: Jack R. Lohmann and Michael L. Corradini
Keywords: Non-Profit Post-Secondary Women Industry Mentoring Mentor Engineering Science Gender Equity

lom:title.lom:string: MentorNet: Large Scale E-Mentoring for Women in Science, Engineering, Technology (SET) Fields
